title: A New Construction of Forests with Low Visibility
abstract:
A set of points with finite density is constructed in $\mathbb{R}^d$, with
$d\geq2$, by adding points to a Poisson process such that any line segment of
length $O\left(\varepsilon^{-(d-1)}\ln\varepsilon^{-1}\right)$ in
$\mathbb{R}^d$ will contain one of the points of the set within distance
$\varepsilon$ of it. The constant implied by the big-$O$ notation depends on
dimension only.
